item.title: [Pi] DialogueHandler help [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @HaizScape HaizScape
item.description:
@HaizScape wrote:

Ehh, I wasn’t entirely sure what you meant by that but I tried this, is this what you meant?

public void processPacket(final Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) { int actionButtonId = Misc.hexToInt(c.getInStream().buffer, 0, packetSize); if(c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(Config.OWNER)) { System.out.println("Dialogue Action ID = 9157"+c.dialogueAction); c.sendMessage(c.playerName+ " - actionbutton: "+actionButtonId); }

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] DialogueHandler help [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

HaizScape:

Whenever I click the yes, and it exits me out, in the chatbox it said I used the actionbutton 9157 and 9158 for no, that means that the id’s are correct right? If it is the dialogueAction variable, how do I set it?

Yes, that means it’s correct. Umm, first try to see what the variable is even set to. Find the code where it prints out the action button id, and add this:

System.out.println("Dialogue Action ID ="+c.dialogueAction);

Then make sure that the ID being printed out is the one you need.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] DialogueHandler help [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @HaizScape HaizScape
item.description:
@HaizScape wrote:

Whenever I click the yes, and it exits me out, in the chatbox it said I used the actionbutton 9157 and 9158 for no, that means that the id’s are correct right? If it is the dialogueAction variable, how do I set it?

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] DialogueHandler help [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Make sure those IDs are correct, by looking at the Ids being printed out when you click the yes or no. If they are right, then it could be the dialogueAction variable, that you didn’t set the variable.

Read full topic

case 9157: if (c.dialogueAction == 90) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(366, 783); c.nomad += 1; c.getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@The Rescue", 29162); return; } else if (c.dialogueAction == 91) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(379, 302); return; } else if (c.dialogueAction == 93) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(406, 302); return; } else if (c.dialogueAction == 92) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(391, 783); return; }

and this to 9158, but still nothing

case 9158: if (c.dialogueAction == 90) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(367, 783); return; } else if (c.dialogueAction == 91) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(380, 817); return; } else if (c.dialogueAction == 92) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(392, 783); return;

item.title: [Pi] DialogueHandler help [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @HaizScape HaizScape
item.description:
@HaizScape wrote:

Hey guys, I’m adding in a quest to my server, and whenever you are talking to an npc and they ask you a question and you can choose yes or no, if you choose the yes it’ll just close out the chat and it doesn’t do anything, and same if you press no. Idk how to fix this, here is the part that it keeps happening in, can you guys help out at all please?

[code] case 360:
sendNpcChat4(“Sir, can you please help me!”, “My father has been kidnapped,”, “by some Varrock guards!”, “Please could you go abd rescue him?”, c.talkingNpc, “Boy”);
c.nextChat = 361;
break;

	case 361:
		sendPlayerChat1("Where did they take him?");
		c.nextChat = 362;
	break;

            case 362:
		sendNpcChat2("They took him to the Taverly Dungeon jail, ", 
		"it's being guarded by a hell hound!", c.talkingNpc, "Boy");
		c.nextChat = 363;
	break;

	case 363:
		sendPlayerChat2("Can't he just fight his way out of there?.");
		c.nextChat = 364;
	break;

            case 364:
		sendNpcChat2("You don't understand, " + c.playerName + ", he's", 
		"been wounded and is very hurt!", c.talkingNpc, "Boy");
		c.nextChat = 365;
	break;

	case 365:
		sendOption2("Sure, I got nothing else to do.", "Nah, I don't even know you, get lost."); (After you click one of these options, it exits the chat.
		c.dialogueAction = 90;
	break;

	case 366:
		sendPlayerChat2("Sure, I got nothing else to do. ", "Meanwhile, wait here and don't wonder off.");
		c.nextChat = 368;
	break;
	
	case 367:
		sendPlayerChat1("Nah, I don't even know you, get lost!");
		c.nextChat = 0;
	break;

            case 368:
		sendNpcChat2("Thank you very much!", "Please hurry though.",c.talkingNpc, "Boy");
		c.nextChat = 0;
	break;

            case 369:
		sendNpcChat2("Please hurry back with my father!", "Please!",c.talkingNpc, "Boy");
		c.nextChat = 0;
	break;[/code]

Read full topic
